Chrysler is recalling about 470,000 Jeep SUVs worldwide.
Certain Jeep Grand Cherokees and Commanders are being recalled because the transmission could shift by itself - from park into neutral - with no warning to the driver.
The source of the problem: cracks in the circuit board that can cause a faulty signal on start-up.
